duties_responsibilities.duty: Supervision and management of staffing, equipment, and technical procedures in the Gnotobiotic Animal Facility.
Performing colony management of germ-free breeding colonies and conducting complex experimental procedures.
Operation and maintenance of flexible film isolator.
Maintenance of real-time animal colony database.
Independently designing and scheduling experimental studies.
Performing surgical procedures utilizing experimental compounds and chemical carcinogens.
Performing injections via various routes and monitoring phenotypes, tumor measurements, and treatment responses.
Collecting blood and tissues, tumor measuring, and supervising husbandry and lower-level technical staff.
May involve the use of potentially hazardous radiological, chemical, and biological materials. Work may include weekends and holidays.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in a field related to biomedical research or four (4) years equivalent experience in the appropriate field in lieu of degree. Foreign educated candidates must have their education evaluated by a company-approved accrediting organization to assure equivalency of qualifications.
